bibl.title: A Greek Magical (?) Ostrakon from Elousa (Haluza).
bibl.note: Elousa (Haluza in Hebrew, Khalasa in Arabic), 20 km south-west of Beer-Sheva, fifth-seventh centuries AD. Excavations in the summers of 1997 and 1998 by the Archaeology Division of the Ben-Gurion University of Beer-Sheva. - Recto. Letters, (some of) which might have a numerical value. - Verso. No text, but only some figures are drawn.
bibl.seg: VERRETH Herbert and Haim GOLDFUS, A Greek Magical (?) Ostrakon from Elousa (Haluza).

Elousa (Haluza in Hebrew, Khalasa in Arabic), 20 km south-west of Beer-Sheva, fifth-seventh centuries AD. Excavations in the summers of 1997 and 1998 by the Archaeology Division of the Ben-Gurion University of Beer-Sheva. - Recto. Letters, (some of) which might have a numerical value. - Verso. No text, but only some figures are drawn.
